properties.Name: Casa Loma
properties.Description: c. 1914 3-story castle offering historical exhibits, private event spaces, and a steakhouse

properties.Name: CN Tower
properties.Description: 1815-ft. communications tower featuring two high-level observation decks and a revolving restaurant

properties.Name: Ripley's Aquarium
properties.Description: Massive aquarium featuring the longest underwater glass tunnel in North America,  daily dive shows, and a huge diversity of marine species

properties.Name: Royal Ontario Museum
properties.Description: Major cultural institution showcasing millions of artistic and cultural artifacts from around the world

properties.Name: Distillery District
properties.Description: Vibrant redevelopment of a former industrial village featuring distilleries, restaurants, boutiques, and historical buildings

properties.Name: Art Gallery of Ontario
properties.Description: One of the largest art galleries in North America featuring over 90,000 contepmorary, historical, and Indigenous works from Canada and abroad

properties.Name: Hockey Hall of Fame
properties.Description: Large exhibition featuring hockey memorabilia

properties.Name: Rogers Centre
properties.Description: Massive baseball park and home of the Toronto Blue Jays

properties.Name: Toronto Zoo
properties.Description: Large zoo with dozens of exhibits, walking paths, and a drive-thru safari

properties.Name: CF Toronto Eaton Centre
properties.Description: Massive indoor mall featuring hundreds of stores and restaurants

properties.Name: Royal Alexandra Theatre
properties.Description: Beautiful historical theatre named after the Danish Princess

properties.Name: Scotiabank Arena
properties.Description: Toronto's flagship sports and entertainment complex hosting professional hockey and basketball games plus live concerts

properties.Name: Bata Shoe Museum
properties.Description: Iconic museum featuring the world's largest footware collection and various cultural exhibits

properties.Name: Kensington Market
properties.Description: Vibrant and colorful neighborhood featuring international cuisine, thrift shops, boutiques, tattoo parlors, and informal graffiti installations

properties.Name: Toronto Island Park
properties.Description: Accessible only by Ferry, the park is made up of several islands, including Ward’s Island, Centre Island and Hanlan’s Point

properties.Name: High Park
properties.Address: 1873 Bloor St W, Toronto, ON M6R 2Z3
properties.Description: Popular urban oasis offers a variety of outdoor recreation including ice-skating, baseball games, nature hikes and exploring the park's greenhouse

properties.Name: Berczy Park
properties.Address: 35 Wellington St E, Toronto, ON M5E 1C6
properties.Description: A 3,606 square metre public park located in the triangle of land between Wellington, Front and Scott streets, across the St. Lawrence Centre for the Arts

properties.Name: Toronto Music Garden
properties.Address: 479 Queens Quay W, Toronto, ON M5V 3M8
properties.Description: Fronting on Toronto's inner harbour, it is one of the city's most enchanted locations with music performances in the summer

properties.Name: Queen's Park
properties.Address: 110 Wellesley St W, Toronto, ON M7A 1A2
properties.Description: Ontario's provincial parliament buildings, fine examples of high Victorian architecture

properties.Name: Bluffer's Park
properties.Address: 5 Bluffers Park, Scarborough, ON M1M 3W3, Canada
properties.Description: The park features a sandy beach, picnic areas, walks, lookouts, a boat launch and visitors' dockage

properties.Name: Humber Bay Park
properties.Address: 100 Humber Bay Park Road East, Toronto, ON M8V 3X7
properties.Description: Incorporates a diversity of native wildflowers, shrubs, trees, grasses, sedges and a variety of physical features known to support butterflies throughout all life cycles.

properties.Name: Woodbine Park
properties.Address: 1695 Queen St E, Toronto, ON M4L 1G7
properties.Description: A park that's popular for outdoor events, with beach swimming, a boardwalk & a skateboard park

properties.Name: Trinity Bellwoods Park
properties.Address: 790 Queen St W, Toronto, ON M6J 1G3
properties.Description: Largest park located in the downtown core

properties.Name: Kew Gardens
properties.Address: 2075 Queen St E, Toronto, ON M4E 2N9
properties.Description: This busy 6.5-hectare park lies in Toronto's Beach neighbourhood and stretches from Queen Street East down to the Lakeshore

properties.Name: Guild Park
properties.Address: 201 Guildwood Pkwy, Scarborough, ON M1E, Canada
properties.Description: This scenic and historic park, formerly Guildwood Park, is a sculptural sanctuary and has beautiful gardens

properties.Name: Centennial Park Greenhouse
properties.Description: Centennial Park Conservatory has tropical and arid displays set alongside seasonal plant displays

properties.Name: Rouge National Urban Park
properties.Description: It is Canada's first national urban park stretching from the Oak Ridges Moraine to the shores of Lake Ontario

properties.Name: Colonel Sam Smith Park
properties.Address: 3145 Lake Shore Blvd W, Etobicoke, ON M8V 4B6
properties.Description: It is home to a variety of plants, trees, birds and other wildlife, as well as a network of paths and the city's first ice skating trail

properties.Name: Rosetta McClain Gardens
properties.Address: 5 Glen Everest Rd, Scarborough, ON M1N 1J2
properties.Description: Features special braille signage, raised planters, rose gardens and a rock fountain surrounded by a pergola

properties.Name: Harriet's Rooftop
properties.Description: Japanese and Asian cuisine with cool roof top

properties.Name: LaVinia Restaurant
properties.Address: 2350 Lake Shore Blvd W, Etobicoke, ON M8V 1B6
properties.Description: Spanish and Mediterranean cuisine

properties.Description: Cool Place for dating and bussines dining

properties.Name: Pai Northern Thai Kitchen
properties.Description: Best Thai and Best Pad Thai in town
